title: Jeffrey Epstein's business ties with banker Ariane de Rothschild revealed
subhed: The latest release of the Epstein files by the US Department of Justice has confirmed the extremely close relationship between the French-German head of the Edmond de Rothschild group and the convicted sex offender. From 2013 until his death in 2019, he acted as an unofficial adviser to the Switzerland-based bank.

title: The 'Washington Post,' legendary American daily, is shaken by mass layoffs

NATO calls for 'restraint' as last US-Russia nuclear treaty expires
subhed: An official from the US-led military alliance said Thursday that 'restraint and responsibility in the nuclear domain is crucial to global security,' adding that Russia and China were both ramping up their nuclear capabilities.

title: Emmanuel Grégoire, Socialist candidate for Paris mayor, details proposals to Le Monde
subhed: Grégoire, who is backed by most of the left, said housing is his top priority and pledged not to increase the City Hall's debt. He also promised to 'break' with the approach of Mayor Anne Hidalgo, whom he served as first deputy mayor.

title: 'The Mastermind,' by Kelly Reichardt: The art of losing oneself
subhed: In telling the story of an art heist gone awry, the director paints a somber and disillusioned portrait of the 1970s.

title: 'Canada, better the 28th EU member than the 51st US state'
subhed: The Canadian prime minister has called for an alliance of middle powers to stand up to the world's great powers. This is a compelling idea, and one that Europe has been pursuing for 60 years, writes Le Monde columnist Pascal Riché.

Ukraine's 'grandfathers' go to war
subhed: The Ukrainian army has an average age of 45, significantly older than European standards. The draft has targeted men between the ages of 25 and 60, which contrasts with recruitment practices typically seen in Western countries.

title: Gabriella Papadakis, ice dancer: 'My mother turned me into a little soldier who let herself be guided by the decisions of others'
subhed: 'I wouldn't be where I am today if...' In this series, Le Monde interviews a personality about a decisive moment in their life. The figure skater and former Olympic champion looks back on a childhood filled with constraints in order to succeed in a demanding and conservative environment.

title: Marine Le Pen's 2027 presidential bid further jeopardized by prosecution at her appeal trial
subhed: By requesting a five-year ban on election to public office on February 3, the prosecution has fueled doubts about Marine Le Pen's ability to run in the 2027 presidential election. The appeals court is due to rule on the case by the summer.

title: The end of US-Russia nuclear treaty is a dangerous signal for deterrance
